title: Isar Aerospace to launch from French Guiana
summary: European small launch vehicle developer Isar Aerospace has signed an agreement with the French space agency CNES to launch its Spectrum rocket from French Guiana.

title: UK’s ‘Astra Carta’ movement sees space sustainability as chance to lead
summary: The U.K. sees satellite servicing, debris removal and orbital sustainability as an opportunity to emerge as a major global space power.

title: NASA tentatively targeting Aug. 29 for maiden flight of SLS moon rocket
summary: NASA is tentatively targeting Aug. 29 for the long-awaited maiden flight of the agency’s huge Space Launch System moon rocket, officials said Wednesday. But they cautioned major challenges remain for the oft-delayed mega rocket and an official date will not be set until later this summer.

title: NASA authorization included in CHIPS Act
summary: The Senate is moving forward with a revised version of a NASA authorization bill that formally authorizes the agency’s Artemis lunar exploration effort and extends operations of the International Space Station.

title: Spire adding microwave sounders to improve weather forecasts
summary: Spire Global said July 20 it plans to improve its weather forecast services by fitting future smallsats in its fleet with microwave sounders from RAL Space, the British government’s national laboratory.

title: Northrop Grumman to conduct FSB-2 SLS solid rocket booster test
summary: As the Space Launch System (SLS) rocket prepares for its first flight as soon as late August, Northrop Grumman is preparing to conduct the program’s Flight Support Booster-2 test firing at its facility in Promontory, Utah. The test is currently scheduled for Thursday, July 21 at 1:00 PM MDT (19:00 UTC).

title: NASA sets late August and early September launch dates for Artemis 1
summary: NASA has reserved three days in late August and early September for the first launch of its Space Launch System rocket to send the Orion spacecraft to orbit around the moon and back.

title: SpaceX’s first Starlink V2 satellites spotted at Starbase
summary: On Monday, SpaceX was spotted loading some of the first Starlink V2 satellite prototypes into a custom mechanism designed to refill Starship’s...

title: The SLS rocket finally has a believable launch date, and it’s soon
summary: The major remaining task? Arming the rocket's flight termination system.

title: Millennium Space reveals results of DARPA’s ‘Red-Eye’ smallsat experiment
summary: The DARPA-funded Red-Eye experiment demonstrated capabilities such as on-board data processing, inter-satellite communications and software-defined radios.
